snippet: Rick Santorum’s trips to the bowling alley appear to be part of a clear effort to drive home his working-class credentials.
abstract: Rick Santorum, trailing Mitt Romney at the polls and in terms of endorsements, has made four appearances at bowling alleys across Wisconsin in an effort to drive home his working-class credentials.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and NICK CORASANITI
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Chilton, Wis., and Nick Corasaniti from New York. Katharine Q. Seelye contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum’s trips to the bowling alley appear to be part of a clear effort to drive home his working-class credentials.

headline.seo: Santorum Goes Bowling for Votes in Chilton, Wis.
headline.main: For Santorum, Hope That Voters See Message as Pins Go Flying
headline.print_headline: For Santorum, Hope That Voters Will See a Message as the Pins Go Flying
